description: a structured classification for a diverse group of living organisms, spanning across several kingdoms and phyla

command.prompt:
Generate 3 new attributes for a table of a structured classification for a diverse group of living organisms, spanning across several kingdoms and phyla. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes to not generate is:
Diet;Habitat;Family;Latin Name;Phylum;Class;Order;Genus;Species;Common Name;Size

Generate real attributes. Do not generate fictional ones. Here are the semi-colon-separated rows of the table by semantic key only:
Common Name
American Alligator
Black Widow
Cooper's Hawk
Dogfish Shark
Earthworm
European Eel
Horseshoe Crab
Sharks, Rays, Skates
Small
Virginia Opossum
Convict Cichlid
Great White Shark
Domestic Dog
African Cichlid

Generate values of real data for all existing rows of the table. Generate and output a new table, include the table header, with only the attributes Common Name, and the new attributes in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Common Name;Average Lifespan;Endangered Status;Native Continent
American Alligator;50-60 years;Least Concern;North America
Black Widow;3 years;Least Concern;North America
Cooper's Hawk;12 years;Least Concern;North America
Dogfish Shark;10-15 years;Near Threatened;North America, Europe
Earthworm;4-8 years;Least Concern;Worldwide
European Eel;15-20 years;Critically Endangered;Europe
Horseshoe Crab;9-12 years;Vulnerable;North America
Sharks, Rays, Skates;Varies;Varies;Varies
Small;-;-;-
Virginia Opossum;2 years;Least Concern;North America
Convict Cichlid;8-10 years;Least Concern;Central America
Great White Shark;25-30 years;Vulnerable;Worldwide
Domestic Dog;10-13 years;Least Concern;Worldwide
African Cichlid;5-8 years;Least Concern;Africa
command.epilogue: The new attributes are Average Lifespan, Endangered Status, and Native Continent. These values are based on information from various scientific and wildlife databases, such as the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Red List, the National Wildlife Federation, and the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History. The Average Lifespan values are typical for each species in captivity or in the wild. The Endangered Status indicates the level of threat each species faces, with options being Least Concern, Near Threatened, Vulnerable, Endangered, Critically Endangered, or Not Evaluated. The Native Continent indicates the continent(s) where each species is naturally found or originated from, with some species being found worldwide.
